forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 5pm. Partly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 9 to 13 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5am, then a chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy. Low around 53, with temperatures rising to around 55 overnight. West southwest wind 10 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the clock ticks past noon in Downtown San Francisco, a certain coolness drifts reminiscent of dampened autumn leaves. The forecast anticipates rain later in the afternoon, which might veil the city in a soft blur as clouds gather with the promise of precipitation. Until then, patches of sun feebly compete with the encroaching clouds, casting a delicate light on the iconic skyline. Expect temperatures to glide from a lofty 62 down to a chillier 60, coaxed by a southwest breeze that whispers tales of the sea. 

Tonight will bring the rain, likely wrapping the city in a comforting embrace of drizzles and mist as the temperatures descend toward a cozy 53 degrees. In this arena of shifting cloud formations, the marine layer lurks discreetly, ready to blanket the Golden Gate with its ethereal touch. For those venturing outdoors, layers will prove benevolent—perhaps a light jacket over a sweater, fortified against the rising winds. A stroll along the Embarcadero seems fitting; the sultry scents of the bay mingling with the promise of rain could invoke a reflective mood, perfect for a café stop or simply watching the world drift by as autumn unfolds.
